meanings.definition: Extremely large or massive in size or scale.
meanings.sent1: The supermassive elephant towered over the other animals in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: The supermassive mountain range stretched across the horizon.
meanings.sent3: The supermassive cake at the party was so big, it took three people to carry it.
meanings.sent4: Her supermassive collection of books filled every shelf in the room.
meanings.sent5: The supermassive spaceship was the largest ever built, capable of carrying thousands of passengers.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a massive object, especially a celestial body.
meanings.sent1: The astronomers discovered a supermassive black hole at the center of the galaxy.
meanings.sent2: The supermassive star emitted a brilliant light that could be seen from far away.
meanings.sent3: The supermassive planet was so heavy that it caused a ripple in space-time.
meanings.sent4: The supermassive asteroid hurtling towards Earth posed a significant threat.
meanings.sent5: The supermassive comet left a trail of glowing debris as it passed by the planet.
